newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: PHILIPPINE SEC MAY PROBE BANKS ON T-BILLS TRADING.
newsitem.headline: PHILIPPINE SEC MAY PROBE BANKS ON T-BILLS TRADING.

text.p: The Philippine Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) may investigate certain banks to check on a possible violation of rules in secondary treasury bills trading, an official said on Thursday.

"Our BED (Brokers and Exchanges Department) has been tasked to look into this matter and if in fact there is basis for it to issue show-cause letters for the purpose of starting an investigation," SEC chairman Perfecto Yasay told a news conference.
The Bureau of Treasury, which monitors the secondary market trading, filed the complaints before the SEC.
Yasay said the violations were very minor such as failure to stamp the receipt papers.
"The violations are not serious ... These are really minor, minor infractions that do not impact upon the credibility or honesty on the part of market players concerned," he added.
